intro: Ossaea flaccida, commonly known as the flaccid ossaea, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to dry environments. The plant features fleshy, ribbed stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. Its leaves are typically succulent, helping it store water in its native habitat. Ossaea flaccida is often found growing in rocky soils and is well-suited to regions with low rainfall.
